quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates
tweet: Examine life, make it worth living 🧐 #Socrates #Philosophy

quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I think therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: The only thing I know is that I know nothing.
author: Socrates
tweet: Knowing nothing, the path to wisdom 🌌 #Socrates #Philosophy

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Liberty consists in doing what one desires.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
tweet: Born free, seek to break the chains ⛓️ #Rousseau #Philosophy

quote: The life of man is solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: One cannot step twice into the same river.
author: Heraclitus
tweet: Life's constant change, like a river 🏞️ #Heraclitus #Philosophy

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

quote: It is undesirable to believe a proposition when there is no ground whatever for supposing it true.
author: Bertrand Russell
tweet: Belief without reason, a risky path 🛤️ #Russell #Philosophy

quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

quote: To understand everything is to forgive everything.
author: Osho

quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
author: Aristotle

quote: Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Ignorance, the root and stem of all evil.
author: Plato

quote: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.
author: Aristotle
tweet: Society, a balance between beast and god 🌍 #Aristotle #Philosophy

quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
author: Aristotle

quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
author: Plato

quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

quote: Morality is not the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but of how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness.
author: Immanuel Kant
tweet: Morality's path to worthiness, not just happiness 😇 #Kant #Philosophy

quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle
tweet: Excellence is a habit, cultivate it 🌱 #Aristotle #Philosophy

quote: Science is what you know, philosophy is what you don't know.
author: Bertrand Russell
tweet: Science vs. Philosophy: Known vs. Unknown 🌌 #Russell #Philosophy

quote: Doubt is the origin of wisdom.
author: René Descartes

quote: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.
tweet: Do right, always the right time ⏰ #MLK #Philosophy

quote: Out of the crooked timber of humanity, no straight thing was ever made.
author: Immanuel Kant
tweet: Humanity's crooked timber, embrace the curves 🌲 #Kant #Philosophy

quote: Wonder is the feeling of the philosopher, and philosophy begins in wonder.
author: Plato

quote: He who dares not grasp the thorn should never crave the rose.
author: Anne Brontë
tweet: Dare to grasp, earn the rose 🌹 #Bronte #Philosophy

quote: To do as one would be done by, and to love one's neighbor as oneself, constitute the ideal perfection of utilitarian morality.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
author: Albert Camus
tweet: Absolute freedom, an act of rebellion ✊ #Camus #Philosophy

quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: James Baldwin

quote: Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is.
author: Albert Camus
tweet: Be who you are, not what you refuse 🐾 #Camus #Philosophy

quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Truth resides in every human heart, and one has to search for it there, and to be guided by truth as one sees it.
author: Mohandas Gandhi

quote: What does not kill me makes me stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The mind is furnished with ideas by experience alone.
author: John Locke

quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
tweet: Find your why, bear any how 🎯 #Nietzsche #Philosophy

quote: We are all fools in love.
author: Jane Austen

quote: I can control my passions and emotions if I can understand their nature.
author: Spinoza

quote: Give me beauty in the inward soul; may the outward and the inward man be at one.
author: Socrates
tweet: Inner beauty, harmony with the outer 🌺 #Socrates #Philosophy
